description:
In advance of @tearsforfearsmusic releasing its first album in 17 years tomorrow, here's our @mintjulepmusic cover of "Shout", a song Roland describes as being about "political protest. It came out in 1984 when a lot of people were still worried about the aftermath of The Cold War and it was basically an encouragement to protest." 

Now out on Bandcamp (other DSPs to follow). Link in profile. 100% of Bandcamp profits will be donated to the @icrc, an organization that is aiming to help Ukrainians and support the work of the Ukrainian Red Cross.

www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine

#tearsforfears #shoutshoutletitallout #politicalprotest #musicstudio #musiccover #musiccovers #synthwave #80smusic #indierock #mintjulepmusic #shoegaze #dreampop #synth

As parents, caregivers, and humans, it's impossible to watch what‚Äôs happening in Europe and to Ukrainian people without feeling a deep sense of grief and fear. Our hearts and prayers are with all those impacted.

We‚Äôve compiled a list of vetted organizations you can donate to if you, like us, are feeling helpless right now.

Charitable Foundation Voices of Children: https://voices.org.ua/en

Nova Ukraine Heart2Heart: https://novaukraine.org/heart2heart-humanitarian-aid/

International Committee of the Red Cross: https://www.icrc.org/en/where-we-work/europe-central-asia/ukraine

Revived Soldiers Ukraine: https://www.rsukraine.org/

Sunflower of Peace: https://www.facebook.com/donate/507886070680475/

United Help Ukraine: https://www.facebook.com/donate/337101825010055/

Come Back Alive: https://savelife.in.ua/en/donate/

Army SOS: https://armysos.com.ua/en/

Yesterday, we have launched a new and exciting color we've been working on for a while.‚Å†
‚Å†
And yet, just like many of you, we have been occupied with the disturbing news about activities in Ukraine. ‚Å†
‚Å†
MagicLinen is not into politics. But, with most of our team and our partners located in Lithuania, we feel a lot of concern for Ukraine.‚Å†
‚Å†
To show our support, we have decided to donate all of today's profits to the Red Cross organization to aid the people who have been affected.‚Å†
‚Å†
For those of you who want to join in support, visit and donate at https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine - or a different organization of your choice.

English:

We stand with the people of Ukraine, who are dealing with horrid imperialist aggression from Putin's regime. We also stand with the Russian people who are being unjustly represented by their government and will be the ones to pay the price of this aggression with their lives and labor."A Bayonet is a Weapon with a Worker on Each End"

Dutch:

Wij staan achter de mensen van Oekra√Øne, die te maken hebben met de afschuwelijke imperialistische aanval van Poetins regime. Ook staan wij achter de bevolking van Rusland die onrechtvaardig worden vertegenwoordigd door hun regering, zei zullen de mensen zijn die de prijs betalen voor deze agressie met hun levens en arbeid.

"Een bajonet is een wapen met aan elk uiteinde een werker"

The Ukrainian people need our prayers and our support. Here are just three of the many excellent organizations helping people affected by this conflict:

International Committee of the Red Cross
Ukraine
In Ukraine, the ICRC is aiding people affected by the war and is supporting the work of the Ukrainian Red Cross..
https://www.icrc.org/en/where-we-work/europe-central-asia/ukraine

International Rescue Committee
The IRC is on the ground in Poland and preparing to support displaced families affected by the Ukraine crisis. Donations will help them provide food, medical care and emergency supplies to refugee families.
https://help.rescue.org/donate/ukraine 

Save the Children
What‚Äôs the Situation for Kids in Ukraine?
At least 7.5 million children in Ukraine are in grave danger of physical harm, severe emotional distress and displacement following an escalation in hostilities overnight. Donations to the Children's Emergency Fund  delivers lifesaving aid to vulnerable children in the Ukraine and around the world. 
https://www.savethechildren.org/us/where-we-work/ukraine

We stand with Ukraine

Please consider financial support for the Red Cross, who actively help the victims of war: https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine

#StandWithUkraine

We stand with Ukraine against Putin's invasion.

Our hearts go out to the brave Ukrainian people, who're currently suffering from this brutal and unjustifiable attack.

As a community, we believe that supporting each other is the only way forward and this is why we'll be donating 10% of March profits from our retail and online sales to help the Ukrainian cause.

Red Cross¬†https://www.icrc.org/donate/ukraine-0

The UN Refugee Agency¬†https://donate.unhcr.org/int/en/ukraine-emergency

It‚Äôs been a heavy few days as we‚Äôve all watched agonizing footage of Ukrainians losing loved ones, fleeing their homes and in complete distress. 

As we continue to pray for them, a reminder that ANY donation can go a long way. I‚Äôve compiled a list of five places to donate that have been all recommended repeatedly by reputable news agencies. They‚Äôre also stories and highlights so you can link directly üôèüèª

1Ô∏è‚É£ UNICEF - help.unicef.org 
Donations to aid the 7.5 million Ukrainian children in danger.

2Ô∏è‚É£ UHCR - giving.unhcr.org/en/ukraine/
Donations to help families displaced by military action in Ukraine. 

3Ô∏è‚É£ ICRC - www.icrc.org
Donations to repair vital infrastructure, support health facilities, and support families with food and hygiene.

4Ô∏è‚É£ CF Voices of Children - voices.org.ua/en/
Donations to help children affected by the war with psychological and psychosocial support.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Vostok SOS - vostok-sos.org/en
Donations to help people evacuate and provide humanitarian aid.

Royal Life Saving Australia is deeply concerned by the events unfolding in Ukraine
As an Australian organisation with a deep commitment to the prevention of the loss of life through water safety, drowning prevention and lifesaving, we oppose this violence. 

The widespread human, social, health and economic impacts are devastating.
We send our deepest concern to our colleagues at the Ukrainian Water Rescue Society. 

In peaceful times, their 15,000 lifesaving members provide rescue services, promote water safety and the teaching of swimming.

We know that these impacts extend across eastern Europe (and further). We stand in solidarity with all who oppose war. Like so many, we hope for a return to peace and stability.

We note that the International Red Cross are funding relief for communities and working closely with the Ukrainian Red Cross Society, they are increasing their response to the humanitarian needs in Ukraine ‚Äì see: 
https://www.icrc.org/en/where-we-work/europe-central-asia/ukraine

Our corporate office is illuminated to show support for the people of Ukraine. In addition, NFI has made a donation to the International Committee of the Red Cross to support their mission. Learn more about their work at https://www.icrc.org/en/

Our Moscow Mousse cocktail has been one of our best selling drinks ever, and we‚Äôve decided to use the last month it‚Äôs available to raise funds for humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. Under its new name, Puck Futin, we‚Äôll be donating $2 of every order to the Ukrainian Red Cross for the rest of the month.

So swing by and have a tasty vanilla chai cocktail and help us say, emphatically, Puck Futin. Budmo!

Il y a quelques mois notre partenaire Ukrainien d√©cidait de localiser Happy City dans son pays.
Dans cette version ukrainienne, nos partenaires avaient jug√© plus sage de remplacer la carte B√¢timent ‚ÄúLa place Rouge‚Äù par une carte b√¢timent plus adapt√©e : ‚ÄúLa porte dor√©e de Kiev, avec la statue de Iaroslav le Sage‚Äù. 
Demande l√©gitime et imm√©diatement accept√©e de notre c√¥t√©. Cette carte a donc √©t√© dessin√©e par l‚Äôillustrateur japonais et devait figurer dans la version ukrainienne du jeu.

La production √©tait sur le point de commencer mais compte tenu du contexte, le jeu ne sortira pas. Pas de ¬´ ville heureuse ¬ª pour l‚ÄôUkraine, un bien lourd symbole.

Nous mesurons aujourd‚Äôhui √† quel point cette carte in√©dite est pleine de sens, et il nous a sembl√© √©vident que celle-ci pourrait nous permettre, √† notre humble √©chelle, d‚Äôaider les Ukrainiens. C‚Äôest la raison pour laquelle nous avons d√©cid√© de la proposer √† tous ceux qui veulent construire leur Happy City avec un b√¢timent qui aidera des personnes dans la vraie vie.

The wall outside Abbey Road Studios is often a place for messages of #peaceandlove. The team at @Audiomovers is heartened by the message that has appeared on the wall today. 

Now part of the Abbey Road family, Audiomovers was founded in Ukraine and continues to be led by a Ukrainian team. In fact the first line of Listento software code was written in Kyiv, now under bombing attack.

At Abbey Road, we feel the devastation and worry of our Audiomovers colleagues and will be supporting the work of the International Red Cross. If you want to help the people of Ukraine, the Audiomovers team asks that you consider supporting: icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine | link in bio.

TOGETHERNESS IS PEACE | Die Ereignisse in der Ukraine haben uns alle tief getroffen und ersch√ºttert. Wir erleben eine unfassbar gro√üe Welle der Solidarit√§t und Soforthilfe. Mitgef√ºhl, Verbundenheit, Zuflucht und Geborgenheit ‚Äì all das ist nicht selbstverst√§ndlich.

In dieser Zeit sind unsere Herzen bei den Menschen in der Ukraine. Nichts ist st√§rker als Verbundenheit. Daher unterst√ºtzen wir als dentsu in Deutschland und der DACH-Region jedes pers√∂nliche Engagement unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter f√ºr die Ukraine ab sofort mit zus√§tzlichen drei freien Social Impact Tagen (‚ÄûVolunteer Days‚Äú).

Unser Dank geht schon jetzt an die vielen engagierten Menschen, die bereits seit Tagen anpacken oder in den Startl√∂chern stehen. Besonders wichtig aber ist Soforthilfe, die auch ankommt, wo sie gebraucht wird. dentsu international hat bereits ein Zeichen gesetzt und unterst√ºtzt mit einer Spende von 250.000 GBP das internationale International Committee of the Red Cross - ICRC.

Auch wir wollen hier bei uns etwas dazu beitragen: dentsu verdoppelt den Betrag, der aus den pers√∂nlichen Spenden aller Mitarbeiter an Projekten oder Organisationen zugunsten der Menschen in der Ukraine entstehen - und das √ºber die gesamte DACH Region. Die dentsu DACH Spende geht ebenfalls an das Rote Kreuz => https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine

Last night, after my family and I observed Ash Wednesday, we joined a vigil in State Circle with nearly 200 people to stand in solidarity with the country and people of Ukraine. We prayed for peace and for this senseless invasion of a sovereign country to come to an end. It was important for my family & I to be there last night - especially as we reflect during this Lenten season and prepare for Easter.  The courage, determination, and fearlessness of the Ukrainians has inspired us all as they protect their homeland against this invasion. üíôüíõ
For those of you looking to help in the assistance of aid to refugees, the International Committee of the Red Cross (@icrc) is responding to the urgent humanitarian needs and doing life-saving work. You can make a donation here - https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine
#StandWithUkrain #Annapolis #AnneArundel #Working4MD

Reading this below broke my heart completely ‚Ä¶
The healthcare workers who put themselves in danger in order to save lives are heroes! Humanity is deeply in debt to these guardian angels.
Meeting the Vice President of the ICRC, Gilles Carbonnier, was a deeply moving and enriching experience.
I hope my wonderful community will follow the various catch up streams of this quartet evening in Geneva and donate to the International Red Cross Ukraine.

Donation link:
https://www.icrc.org/en/annesophiemutter

We had planned to celebrate having 1 million followers on Instagram in a different way, but today FitCoach as a company has decided to use this as an opportunity to bring attention to the ruthless war going on in Ukraine.

We strongly condemn the unprovoked Russian military invasion of peaceful Ukraine. Millions of people have had to evacuate their homes and have been forced into bomb shelters. This is heartbreaking and absolutely cannot be happening in the 21st century. Our company is donating funds to help Ukrainians on a weekly basis and will keep to this commitment until the war is over.

If you are a FitCoach user, we have added a special feature to the app to let you make a donation to support Ukrainians. Please update your app to use the new donation feature.

You can also follow the link in our highlights to contribute to saving lives together with the International Red Cross: https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine

AUCTION ENDED! Final High Bid: $11,500 via @northerndream (thank you!) ///
We‚Äôve been deeply affected and saddened by the violence and destruction happening in Ukraine right now and wanted to use the TGN platform to make any difference we can. So we‚Äôve decided to host an auction, with all proceeds going directly to the International Committee of the Red Cross. The ICRC (@icrc) is doing important work in Ukraine, and for the thousands of refugees fleeing the war.

This is a great opportunity to contribute to a great cause while also scoring an AMAZING selection of gear that we‚Äôve pulled together with the help of a number of contributing listeners and brands. It‚Äôs a kit chock-full of gear squarely in the TGN wheelhouse‚Äîreading material, travel goods, sartorial accessories, a killer clock, and an awesome watch. See the full list below.
Here‚Äôs how it works: The auction is open now. Bid on the whole package by adding a comment on this post. You can increase bids in any increment and bid as often as you like. The auction ends at 10pm Eastern Daylight Time on Wednesday, March 23rd.
The winner must donate to ICRC directly (https://www.icrc.org/en/donate/ukraine) and then send us a receipt as proof of the payment. We will try to ship off the package by the 29th of March. The auction is open to anyone that lives where FedEx will deliver, but you're on the hook for any local taxes or import duties. The package will be sent from the US. Good luck and thanks for your support!

üá∫üá¶üïäRUN FOR PEACEüïäüá∫üá¶
‚Ä¢
FREE Run Sunday, March 27th!  10am ET
‚Ä¢

Since the invasion of Ukraine on February 24th, Charge has been working diligently to determine how we can, as a company and community, best help promote peace and aid in the humanitarian efforts for the people of Ukraine.
‚Ä¢
We feel grateful to be able to help by hosting The Run for Peace on Sunday, March 27th! This is a FREE global event bringing together the world‚Äôs running community in an expression of solidarity with the people of Ukraine. 

This is a FREE event with 100% of proceeds and donations going to direct support of the work of the ICRC. We encourage all to participate, and to visit the ICRC website (https://www.icrc.org/en), become informed, and spread the message of peace, love, and support for Ukraine!

Join us as we run, walk, and move in an expression of our support for peace and an end to the unwarranted conflict and crisis in Ukraine.

My new song is out today on Soundcloud.

I usually don't speak about this, because I consider that music is music, but not only as a citizen but more a human being in this world, I need to speak and try to do something on my position. This song delivers a simple message : "stop the war !".

I have no words to describe what is happening right now in Europe (and more generally in the world), feeling that I can't do nothing, so maybe that this song can spread a bit the message (I already know if you listen to this genre of music, you might already know), for those who can't have access to it, after the closing of social medias in Russia.

I needed to speak out, to do the little I can do on my side, to use the little power of communication that I have to share this. People in Russia, I know it is easier to write it than doing there, but please, rise against your government, they can't control you all, show it to them, that this is over. Don't let the future teaching you, your future children, and your country that in moments when you were told the truth, you looked in another direction. The whole world is rising against this, join us.

For people who want to help Ukrainian refugees or civilians in Ukraine, don't hesitate to support with money (even 10 euros is a lot, if 1000 people do it, it is 10 000 euros at the end) with international, european and national GNO (like for example : www.icrc.org/). But even closer to you, support local associations by bringing them some food, some clothes, some time and some humanity.

Help how much you can help, never make a ranking about who should deserve more than others. Everybody deserves to live in peace.

Thanks a lot if you have been reading this until here. We are together, let's not let them trying to confront us, we have 3 words "stop the war", because none of us want.

#frenchcore #stoptheviolence #stopthewar

Free League Donates 50% of all Webshop Proceeds March 18-21 to the Red Cross in Ukraine‚Å†
‚Å†
50% of all proceeds from the Free League webshop during March 18‚Äì21 will go to support the work of the International Red Cross and its humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. This includes our entire portfolio, including tabletop RPGs, board games, and books.‚Å†
‚Å†
Like so many others across Europe and the world, we have been horrified by the events of the past few weeks and we deplore the humanitarian disaster unfolding as a result of the invasion of Ukraine. We at Free League feel that we need to do something together with our fans to help, and we urge everyone in our community do the same.‚Å†
-Tomas H√§renstam, CEO and co-founder‚Å†

About the International Red Cross in Ukraine‚Å†
‚Å†
The ICRC has been working in Ukraine since 2014. Their operations in the country are among the ten largest ICRC operations worldwide with a team of over 600 staff members. Working closely with the Ukrainian Red Cross Society, they are increasing their response to the humanitarian needs in Ukraine. Their support to people includes emergency assistance such as food, water, and other essential items. They also support hospitals and primary healthcare facilities with medical equipment and emergency preparedness. They repair water stations and support households to rehabilitate their damaged homes. They also help families separated by the conflict reconnect.

Tonight üá∫üá¶ Monday 21 March at 7.30pm St John‚Äôs in the Village presents an Opera and Classical Music Gala Ukrainian Benefit Concert.
The concert features arias and ensemble pieces from Romantic opera as well as instrumental music for violin and piano, performed by professional musicians from Ukraine and other nations: pianist Alexander Chaplinskiy; sopranos Zoya Gramagin and Sara Pearson; mezzo-sopranos Eugenia Forteza, Ema Mitroviƒá, and Galina Ivannikova; bass-baritone Jonathan R. Green; and the instrumental duet of Yulia Basis and Andy Didorenko. Works by an array of composers will be featured, including Ukrainian and Russian works. "We stand with Ukrainians and with those brave Russians who dare speak up against the invasion and protest in the streets or media,‚Äù says Natalie Burutskaya, producer and artist manager with the company. Tickets (from $40) can be purchased in advance at Eventbrite.com @eventbrite and payment can also be made at the door (though this concert is likely to sell out). All advance ticket sales guarantee admission but a $100 ticket purchased in advance secures you a reserved seat. The concert is in-person only and not webcast. You must be fully vaccinated to attend and face-coverings must be worn. 

All proceeds will go to Benice LLC (Asnova Holding) in Kyiv. This company organizes help to those who are left homeless after bombing and who (especially those with children) need to be evacuated from their places and given a roof and food immediately. This provides very targeted help exactly where it is needed through an organization known to and trusted by Natalie Burutskaya and the producers of the concert.

If you cannot attend this concert but would like to help the Ukrainian people at this time, there are, of course, very, very many worthy charities one can give to. Here are four:
